definition: when things come to a head (idiom)
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before

head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: If you don't anticipate what may happen, you'll find yourself at a loss when sth. crops up.
sentences.chinese: 你如果没有思想准备，事到临头就会抓瞎。

sentences.english: Try not to think actively about the task before it actually happens.
sentences.chinese: 除非事到临头，否则不要提前想着它。

sentences.english: They deal with an issue as and when it rears its head.
sentences.chinese: 事到临头他们才会开始处理。

as matters stand/things having reached this stage
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
if you ride a tiger, it's hard to get off (idiom); fig. impossible to stop halfway
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction
afraid of the head, terrified of the tail (idiom); ever fearful and nervous/afraid of the slightest thing
cannot help/to be beyond control of
to be facing imminent calamity (idiom)/disaster is looming
counter soldiers with arms, water with an earth weir (idiom); different situations call for different action/to adopt measures appropriate to the actual situation

definition: facing a powerful enemy (idiom); fig. confronting grave difficulties/Enemy at the Gates, 1991 movie by Jean-Jacques Annaud
